DataElement.preferredName: Malignant Neoplasm Plan Minimum Invasive Surgical Procedure Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: they yes/no indicator regarding information related to a planned diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means by the least invasive way possible for a benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Malignant Neoplasm Plan Minimum Invasive Procedure Surgical Procedure
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a planned diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means by the least invasive way possible for a benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Refers to abnormal cell activity manifested by decreased control over growth and function, causing tumor growth or spread into surrounding tissue and adverse effects to the host.:A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Concepts.definition: Refers to abnormal cell activity manifested by decreased control over growth and function, causing tumor growth or spread into surrounding tissue and adverse effects to the host.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredName: Plan Minimum Invasive Procedure Surgical Procedure
Property.preferredDefinition: To devise, contrive, or form in design.:The smallest possible quantity.:A medical procedure that invades (enters) the body, usually by cutting or puncturing the skin or by inserting instruments into the body.:A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Concepts.definition: To devise, contrive, or form in design.
A procedure requiring physical intrusion of the body.

A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
